message_1: Consider a substitution cipher where alphabet letters are shifted by 3 positions. What is the ciphertext for the plain text "MATH" using this cipher?
message_2:
To encode the plain text "MATH" using a substitution cipher with a shift of 3 positions, we will shift each letter in the word 3 positions forward in the alphabet. If a letter goes beyond 'Z', it will wrap around to the beginning of the alphabet.

M -> P (M + 3 = P)
A -> D (A + 3 = D)
T -> W (T + 3 = W)
H -> K (H + 3 = K)

So, the ciphertext for the plain text "MATH" using this cipher is "PDWK".
